title: First State National Historical Park: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address           New Castle Court House Museum 211 Delaware Street   New Castle, DE 19720                 Directions         There are three main visitor locations at First State National Historical Park. For details and directions for each one, visit, http://www.nps.gov/frst/planyourvisit/directions.htm.  Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons         Beaver Valley (Woodlawn Tract) Beaver Valley (Woodlawn Tract) consists of 1,100 acres of rolling hills and wooded areas are located along the Brandywine River and the arced border between northern Delaware and southern Pennsylvania.    Standard Hours    Sunday: Sunrise - Sunset   Monday: Sunrise - Sunset   Tuesday: Sunrise - Sunset   Wednesday: Sunrise - Sunset   Thursday: Sunrise - Sunset   Friday: Sunrise - Sunset   Saturday: Sunrise - Sunset      Fort Christina Fort Christina is closed, except for special events. It was here, along the banks of the Christina River over 375 years ago, that the first Swedish and Finnish American settlers aboard the Kalmar Nyckel and the Fogel Grip landed and settled the first American Swedish colony, New Sweden.    Standard Hours    Sunday: Closed   Monday: Closed   Tuesday: Closed   Wednesday: Closed   Thursday: Closed   Friday: Closed   Saturday: Closed      Old Swedes Church Generally open Wednesday-Saturday. Hours change seasonally. Visit, http://www.oldswedes.org/visitor-information/, for the most up to date information.    Standard Hours    Sunday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Monday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Tuesday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Wednesday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Thursday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Friday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Saturday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM      New Castle Court House Museum Historic New Castle served as the colonial capital of Delaware until 1777 and provides valuable stories of our country's earliest settlers and founding fathers. The museum is closed on state holidays. For more information, visit, http://history.delaware.gov/museums/ncch/visitors.shtml.    Standard Hours    Sunday: 1:30 PM - 4:30 PM   Monday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Tuesday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Wednesday: 10:00 AM - 3:30 PM   Thursday: 10:00 AM - 3:30 PM   Friday: 10:00 AM - 3:30 PM   Saturday: 10:00 AM - 3:30 PM      The Green, Dover William Penn established the town of Dover in 1683. As surveyed in 1717, the town featured three public squares including The Green. For more information, visit, http://www.destateparks.com/park/first-state-heritage/programs/index.asp.    Standard Hours    Sunday: Sunrise - Sunset   Monday: Sunrise - Sunset   Tuesday: Sunrise - Sunset   Wednesday: Sunrise - Sunset   Thursday: Sunrise - Sunset   Friday: Sunrise - Sunset   Saturday: Sunrise - Sunset      John Dickinson Plantation Home to John Dickinson, known as the "penman of the Revolution" because his writings helped inspire colonial opposition to Great Britain, this site was built in 1739 and located about 6 miles southeast of The Green in Dover. For details visit, http://history.delaware.gov/museums/jdp/visitors.shtml.    Standard Hours    Sunday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Monday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Tuesday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Wednesday: 10:00 AM - 3:30 PM   Thursday: 10:00 AM - 3:30 PM   Friday: 10:00 AM - 3:30 PM   Saturday: 10:00 AM - 3:30 PM      Ryves Holt House This house, built in 1665 in Lewes, Delaware by early Dutch settlers, is thought to be built thirty years after the destruction of the nearby ill-fated Zwaanendael colony, one of the first Dutch settlements in America, and first European settlement in Delaware. It is open January-March: Friday–Monday, 11 am–4 pm, April-December: daily, 10 am–5 pm. For more information visit, https://www.historiclewes.org/visit/museums.   Standard Hours    Sunday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Monday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Tuesday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Wednesday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Thursday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Friday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Saturday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM             Weather           For details and information, visit, http://www.nps.gov/frst/index.htm.          Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   First State Fees - $0.00 There are no fees to visit First State National Monument. Some partner sites may charge fees for some services. For more information about our partner sites, please visit, http://www.nps.gov/frst/planyourvisit/placestogo.htm.          Visitor Centers                              Operating Hours & Seasons               Fees & Passes             To learn more about the sites and programs included in our National Historical Park visit: Operating Hours & Seasons  Are you interested in visiting First State? Learn more about our Fees & Passes.
